homes_hear_details: Connecticut has launched its HOMES and HEAR rebate programs. The Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection (DEEP) administers the programs, leveraging the existing Energize CT infrastructure and the Connecticut Green Bank.
state_energy_office: Connecticut Department of Energy and Environmental Protection (DEEP)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Connecticut, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Hartford County, 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $72,800. Fairfield County (near NYC) has higher thresholds.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Connecticut, 150% of Area Median Income in Hartford County for a family of four is approximately $136,500.

net_metering: Connecticut has net metering for residential systems up to 25 kW. Under Public Act 18-50, the state transitioned to a tariff-based structure. Residential customers receive a net metering credit at the retail rate for projects up to 25 kW. The program has a statewide cap that is periodically reviewed and adjusted by the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority (PURA).

state_rebate_programs.name: Energize CT Home Energy Solutions
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Eversource and United Illuminating (UI), through Energize CT
state_rebate_programs.amount: Subsidized home energy audit for $50 (or free for income-qualifying households); includes free LED bulbs, water-saving devices, and air sealing
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Home energy assessment, air sealing, duct sealing, LED lighting, pipe insulation, smart power strips, programmable thermostats
state_rebate_programs.details: This is the core residential energy efficiency program in Connecticut. The audit identifies opportunities for deeper retrofits with additional rebates. Income-qualifying households (up to 60% of state median income) receive the assessment and measures at no cost.

state_rebate_programs.name: Energize CT Heating and Cooling Rebates
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Eversource and United Illuminating (UI), through Energize CT
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $15,000 for ground source heat pumps; up to $3,000 for air source heat pumps; up to $750 for heat pump water heaters
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air source heat pumps, ductless mini-splits, ground source heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, high-efficiency boilers and furnaces
state_rebate_programs.details: Connecticut has been aggressively promoting heat pump adoption. Rebate amounts vary by system type and efficiency. Additional incentives may be available for income-qualifying households.

state_rebate_programs.name: Connecticut Green Bank Residential Programs
state_rebate_programs.amount: Low-interest financing; Smart-E Loan rates starting at approximately 4.49%-6.99% APR
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Solar PV, battery storage, heat pumps, insulation, windows, energy efficiency improvements, electric vehicle chargers
state_rebate_programs.details: The Connecticut Green Bank (the nation's first state green bank) offers low-interest financing products for residential clean energy. The Smart-E Loan program is available through participating local lenders.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Connecticut Department of Social Services, through community action agencies
state_rebate_programs.amount: Free comprehensive weatherization for qualifying households
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair/replacement, windows, health and safety measures
state_rebate_programs.details: For income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

state_rebate_programs.name: Residential Solar Investment Program (RSIP) - Legacy
state_rebate_programs.amount: Program fully subscribed; replaced by Residential Solar Energy Credits (RSEC)
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Solar PV systems for residential properties
state_rebate_programs.details: The original RSIP program is fully subscribed. Connecticut now uses a tariff-based incentive (RSEC) for new residential solar installations, administered through PURA.
